question: How do I view logs for a specific systemd service?

golden_answer.summary: Use 'journalctl -u <service>' to view service logs, with options for filtering by boot, time, or priority.
steps: View all logs for service: journalctl -u <service-name>
View logs from current boot only: journalctl -u <service-name> -b
Show logs since specific time: journalctl -u <service-name> --since '1 hour ago'
validation: Can identify errors or issues from log output
warnings: Journal can be large - use filters (boot, time, priority) to narrow results
Use -b to see only current boot (helpful after reboot)
Logs rotate automatically but can be cleaned with journalctl --vacuum-size=100M
